title: Paragraph Structure and Organization

vocab.definition: A group of sentences that are all about the same main idea
The sentence that tells the main idea of a paragraph
Sentences that give more information about the main idea
The last sentence that wraps up the paragraph
A word or phrase that connects ideas and sentences
All sentences in a paragraph support the same main idea
Ideas are arranged clearly so the paragraph is easy to follow
To start a new paragraph by leaving a small space at the beginning of the first line
An interesting first sentence that grabs the reader's attention
Facts, examples, or reasons that back up the main idea
A specific detail that shows or proves the idea
To improve writing by adding, removing, or changing words and sentences
Something you enjoy doing in your free time
Keeping all sentences focused on one main idea
A planning chart that helps you arrange your ideas
The order that events or ideas happen
A reason that explains or proves the main idea

teachingNotes: Use graphic organizers like hamburger models. Practice identifying parts of paragraphs before writing. Focus on one main idea per paragraph.

sample.question: What is the job of a topic sentence?
expectedAny: states what the paragraph is about

sample.question: What are supporting details?
expectedAny: sentences that explain the main idea
facts and examples that support the idea

sample.question: What is a concluding sentence?
expectedAny: brings the paragraph to a close

sample.question: How many main ideas should a paragraph have?
What is a paragraph?
expectedAny: group of sentences about same idea
sentences that all go with one main idea

sample.question: Where does the topic sentence usually go?

truefalse.question: A good paragraph should have only one main idea.
Supporting details are unrelated to the main idea.
A concluding sentence can restate the main idea.
Paragraphs should always be one sentence long.
The topic sentence is always the last sentence.

multiplechoice.question: Which sentence would be the best topic sentence for a paragraph about dogs as pets?
choices: I have a dog named Max.
My dog likes to play fetch.

multiplechoice.question: Which is a supporting detail for that topic?
choices: Dogs can be trained to help people.
expectedAny: dogs can be trained to help people

multiplechoice.question: Which transition fits next? 'First, I feed my fish. ____ , I clean the tank.'
Which sentence is a conclusion?
choices: In conclusion, dogs can be great friends.
expectedAny: in conclusion, dogs can be great friends.
In conclusion, dogs can be great friends.

multiplechoice.question: Which does NOT belong in a paragraph about brushing teeth?
Where is the topic sentence usually found?
Which detail supports the main idea 'Recess is important'?

fillintheblank.question: A paragraph needs a _____ sentence to introduce the main idea and _____ details to explain it.

shortanswer.question: How do supporting details help make a paragraph better?
Write a topic sentence for a paragraph about a hobby you enjoy.
expectedAny: the best hobby for me is __

shortanswer.question: List three transitions you could use in a how-to paragraph.
Write a concluding sentence for a paragraph about school lunches.

expectedAny: you can go on adventures in stories

shortanswer.question: Explain why unity is important in a paragraph.
expectedAny: everything stays about the same topic

shortanswer.question: Revise these three sentences to improve unity: keep only ideas that support one topic.
